meanings.sent1: Her explanation was creditable, so I trusted her.
meanings.sent2: The scientist's research findings were creditable and accepted by the community.
meanings.sent3: It was quite creditable how the cat convinced the dog to share its toy.
meanings.sent4: The student's dedication to learning was as creditable as a shining star in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The detective's attention to detail was so creditable that no clue escaped her notice.

meanings.sent1: His hard work on the project was truly creditable.
meanings.sent2: The artist's masterpiece was so creditable that it won multiple awards.
meanings.sent3: The chef's attempt at making a cake out of vegetables was definitely creditable.
meanings.sent4: The team's unity and cooperation were as creditable as a symphony playing in perfect harmony.
meanings.sent5: The firefighter's bravery in rescuing the kitten was incredibly creditable.

meanings.definition: Capable of being credited or acknowledged
meanings.sent1: The company's success was creditable to its innovative strategies.
meanings.sent2: The author's latest book was highly creditable and received positive reviews.
meanings.sent3: The magician's ability to make objects disappear was quite creditable.
meanings.sent4: The athlete's speed and agility were as creditable as a cheetah in the wild.
meanings.sent5: The singer's powerful voice was so creditable that it left the audience in awe.
